sources.title: Mystery of the Wax Museum (1933)
sources.description: Mystery of the Wax Museum is an American pre-Code mystery-horror film directed by Michael Curtiz and starring Lionel Atwill, Fay Wray, Glenda Farrell, and Frank McHugh. In the film,  sculptor Ivan Igor, after surviving a fire set by his partner, reopens a wax museum in New York City. As a reporter investigates the mysterious disappearances of bodies linked to the museum, she uncovers Igor's dark secret of using real corpses to create his lifelike sculptures.

metadata.Plot: In London, sculptor Ivan Igor struggles in vain to prevent his partner Worth from burning his wax museum...and his 'children.' Years later, Igor starts a new museum in New York, but his maimed hands confine him to directing lesser artists. People begin disappearing (including a corpse from the morgue); Igor takes a sinister interest in Charlotte Duncan, fiancée of his assistant Ralph, but arouses the suspicions of Charlotte's roommate, wisecracking reporter Florence.
metadata.Writer: Don Mullaly, Carl Erickson, Charles Belden
metadata.Actors: Lionel Atwill, Fay Wray, Glenda Farrell
